body.name: The Last Green Valley: A Novel
body.description: “Mark Sullivan has done it again! The Last Green Valley is a compelling and inspiring story of heroism and courage in the dark days at the end of World War II.” --Kristin Hannah, number one New York Times best-selling authorFrom the author of the number one best seller Beneath a Scarlet Sky comes a new historical novel inspired by one family’s incredible story of daring, survival, and triumph.In late March 1944, as Stalin’s forces push into Ukraine, young Emil and Adeline Martel must make a terrible decision: Do they wait for the Soviet bear’s intrusion and risk being sent to Siberia? Or do they reluctantly follow the wolves - murderous Nazi officers who have pledged to protect “pure-blood” Germans?The Martels are one of many families of German heritage whose ancestors have farmed in Ukraine for more than a century. But after already living under Stalin’s horrifying regime, Emil and Adeline decide they must run in retreat from their land with the wolves they despise to escape the Soviets and go in search of freedom.Caught between two warring forces and overcoming horrific trials to pursue their hope of immigrating to the West, the Martels’ story is a brutal, complex, and ultimately triumphant tale that illuminates the extraordinary power of love, faith, and one family’s incredible will to survive and see their dreams realized. Read more

productInformation.value: #1,520 in Audible Books & Originals (See Top 100 in Audible Books & Originals) #6 in Biographical Fiction (Audible Books & Originals) #7 in World War II Historical Fiction (Audible Books & Originals) #23 in Biographical Fiction (Books)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Family of Heroes Survived the Holocaust
reviews.reviewText: This is a must read for all who are interested in this war/era. Once into it you will read one heart-wrenching event in their lives after another. A hard to pu down book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: At times while reading this inspiring book I had to stop and close it up. It was difficult to realize how brutal we humans can treat each other. I didn't realize until the authors notes that it was a truthful account of the family. If only all Americans could understand how truly blessed we are to live in freedom. This book should be a must read for world history students.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars a must read!
reviews.reviewText: It takes history, gives it heart, intrigue, and passions lived out in people, and brings it to life! The horror, the brutality, disgust, and injustice was so real! I hope we can learn from this and never relive this again!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Caught between Joseph Stalin & Adolph Hitler
reviews.reviewText: An historical book about farmers in the Ukraine that got caught between Joseph Stalin & Adolph Hitler. Truly engaging, a page turner. The survival of a family. While we're dealing with our own southern border crisis, this book makes us realise how lucky we are to be living in America & the allure of so many others, to this country for freedom & opportunity.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Last Green Valley- Incredible story!!
reviews.reviewText: I rarely give a book 5 stars but this one was an incredible read about a families struggles for freedom, based on a true story. Very well written, author lays out the journey for life , liberty, and freedom in an engaging story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What an inspiring, captivating, and beautiful story! It took a bit for me to get into it, then I couldn’t put it down. I wish it went on in greater detail of their lives in story form with a part 2. Such a wonderful book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m not sure what happened to my original review. Just posting now so this will show as read in Goodreads

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everyone should read this!!
reviews.reviewText: This book is Very emotional. We'll written. We cannot forget what people have gone through. I'm grateful to Mark Sullivan for bringing this ONE families story to life. Sadly this is ONE. There are too many similar.
This was a great book. A historical fiction based on true events, keeps you captured the whole time. Good luck putting the book down!

reviews.reviewTitle: A realidade de refugiados de guerra que não perderam a esperança é a fé!
reviews.reviewText: Para quem, como eu, que gosta de reviver histórias de luta e sobrevivência da segunda guerra mundial, de pessoas comuns. Às vezes parecem um sofrimento sem fim, mas o autor soube contar a história real, e com isso nos prender no mesmo fio de esperança que a família relatada no livro. Esse livro renova nossas esperanças e nos faz ver a nossa realidade de uma forma mais leve, com um propósito maior.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: hands down one of th ebest books i have ever read

reviews.reviewTitle: (English edition) A slow, dreary tale of woe...
reviews.reviewText: With 40% read I finally gave up before slitting my own wrists.... No doubt it improves as the title suggests, but quite frankly I'd had enough. Well written, but the story is very slow to develop.
Another great story written in a great way!
